entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story, a student at Hogwarts. He has an ache in his right temple and is worried about finishing his homework.

entities.name: seamus
entities.description: Seamus is another student at Hogwarts who Harry passes on the way to the dormitories. He seems to be trying to speak to Harry, but Harry ignores him.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a staff member at Hogwarts who is absent from the staff table at breakfast. His absence is noted by Ron and Hermione.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is a staff member at Hogwarts who is not present at breakfast, which is seen as a positive development by Ron.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry's friend and classmate. He is concerned about Snape's absence and tries to get Hermione to talk about what she's pleased about.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is Harry's friend and classmate. She seems to be pleased about something, but doesn't reveal what it is when Ron asks her.

relationships.description: Harry passes Seamus on the way to the dormitories, but ignores him and speeds up. It seems like Seamus was trying to speak to Harry.
Harry is relieved that Snape is not present at breakfast, which suggests that he has a negative relationship with Snape.
Ron notes Hagrid's absence from the staff table and seems to be concerned about it. He is trying to get information about why Hagrid is absent.
Ron tries to get Hermione to talk about what she's pleased about, which suggests that they have a friendly and inquiring relationship.
